meanings.definition: situated not far above the ground
meanings.sent1: The bird built its nest in a low tree.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to hide in low bushes.
meanings.sent3: The low flowerpot tried to reach the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The low clouds hugged the mountains tightly.
meanings.sent5: The low fence marked the boundary of the garden.

meanings.definition: below the usual or average level
meanings.sent1: The temperature is low in winter.
meanings.sent2: Her grades were low this semester.
meanings.sent3: The low river made the boat trip slower.
meanings.sent4: The low tide revealed hidden treasures on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The low prices attracted many customers to the store.

meanings.sent1: They lived in a low-income neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: After losing his job, he was low on funds.
meanings.sent3: The low wallet couldn't afford the expensive meal.
meanings.sent4: Her low budget forced her to be creative with gifts.
meanings.sent5: The low bank account made her anxious about bills.

meanings.sent1: Please keep the music low in the library.
meanings.sent2: The low hum of the refrigerator was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The low voice whispered secrets in the quiet room.
meanings.sent4: The low chirping of birds signaled the start of dawn.
meanings.sent5: The low volume of the TV allowed for peaceful reading.

meanings.sent1: She felt low after the breakup.
meanings.sent2: His low mood affected his daily activities.
meanings.sent3: The low spirit needed a boost of positivity.
meanings.sent4: The low emotions clouded her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The low morale in the team needed uplifting.
